skill.name: model-discovery
skill.description: Fetch current model names from AI providers (Anthropic, OpenAI, Gemini, Ollama), classify them into tiers (fast/default/heavy), and detect new models. Use when needing up-to-date model IDs for API calls or when other skills reference model names.
skill.summary: Fetch current model names from AI providers (Anthropic, OpenAI, Gemini, Ollama), classify them into ...
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Python utility scripts fetch model lists from legitimate AI provider APIs. No data exfiltration, no credential theft, no code execution beyond documented purpose. Network access limited to Anthropic, OpenAI, Gemini, and Ollama official endpoints.

content.value_statement: AI model names change frequently. This skill fetches current model lists from Anthropic, OpenAI, Gemini, and Ollama, then classifies them by performance tier for optimal model selection.
actual_capabilities: Fetch model lists from Anthropic, OpenAI, Gemini, and Ollama APIs
Classify models into fast, default, and heavy performance tiers
Cache results for 24 hours to reduce API calls
Auto-classify new models using naming pattern matching
limitations: Requires valid API keys for cloud providers (Anthropic, OpenAI, Google)
Local Ollama must be running to fetch local models
Does not execute code with discovered models
Tier classification is pattern-based and may not reflect actual performance

use_cases.title: Update model references
use_cases.description: Replace hardcoded model names with current alternatives before API calls

use_cases.title: Automated testing
use_cases.description: Check for new models in deployment scripts and update model selectors

use_cases.title: Model comparison
use_cases.description: Browse available models across providers and compare capabilities

prompt_templates.title: List all models
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch all available models from all providers using the model-discovery skill

prompt_templates.title: Check for new models
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if any new models have been released by running the new model detection script

prompt_templates.title: Get fast tier model
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the fastest available model for simple tasks from the model-discovery tier mappings

prompt_templates.title: Classify new model
prompt_templates.prompt: Auto-classify any newly detected models and add them to the known models registry

output_examples.input: Fetch all models from Anthropic and OpenAI

best_practices: Run fetch_models.py before any workflow that references model names
Use tier classification to match model capability to task complexity
Keep API keys in environment variables, never hardcode them
anti_patterns: Hardcoding model version numbers without checking current availability
Using the same model tier for all tasks regardless of complexity
Skipping new model detection after initial setup

faq.question: Which AI providers are supported?
faq.answer: Anthropic Claude, OpenAI GPT, Google Gemini, and local Ollama are supported with API key or local server.

faq.question: How often does the cache refresh?
faq.answer: Cache refreshes every 24 hours by default. Use --force flag to bypass cache and fetch fresh data.

faq.question: Can this skill execute code with the models?
faq.answer: No. This skill only discovers and classifies model names. It does not make API calls to generate content.

faq.question: Is my API key data safe?
faq.answer: API keys are read from environment variables only. No keys are stored, logged, or transmitted beyond provider APIs.

faq.question: What if a provider API is down?
faq.answer: Errors are reported in output but do not block other providers. Cached data can be used when APIs are unavailable.

faq.question: How is tier classification determined?
faq.answer: Tier classification uses pattern matching on model names. Heavy models contain -pro, -opus, or -max. Fast models contain -mini, -nano, or -flash.
